issue.title: [FCD] Effects of resize(size()) on a list

discussion.p: There is no mention of what happens if sz==size(). While it obviously does nothing I feel a standard needs to say this explicitely.
Express the semantics as pseudo-code similarly to the way it is done for the copying overload that follows (in p3). Include an else clause that does nothing and covers the sz==size() case.

blockquote.blockquote: Effects: If sz < size(), equivalent to list<T>::iterator it = begin(); advance(it, sz); erase(it, end());. Iif size() < sz, appends sz - size() default constructed value initialized elements to the sequence.; otherwise, has no effect.
